comments:
The following exception is printed to the console, when executing a TPTP JUnit test:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.ProcessImpl.getAgentsByType(ProcessImpl.java)
	at
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.ProcessImpl.waitForAgent(ProcessImpl.java:813)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.ExecutorStub$2.run(ExecutorStub.java:433)
	at
org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.task.ReusableThread.run(ReusableThread.java:131)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:813)

The problem seems to be with agent.getType() that returns a null value. In the
debugger, then _agents field contains two AgentImpl objects, both of them have
the same name, one of them has a valid type, and the other one has a null type.
Normally, there should be only one Agent within the process.

This has been fixed late last week (partly by me) and early Saturday by Samson.
 New client side code is required (org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core plug-in,
potentially local and collection.framework as well).  Newest builds (that are
good and not bad) for TPTP 4.1 should include this fix.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 111132 ***
